abstract: Human Rights Watch concludes Syrian government dropped barrel bombs on at least 1,450 rebel-held sites since the United Nations Security Council passed a measure against practice Feb 22, 2014; conclusion is based on satellite images, photos, videos and witness statements.
lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch said Tuesday that the Syrian government had dropped so-called barrel bombs on hundreds of heavily populated rebel-held areas in the past year, flouting a United Nations Security Council measure.

headline.main: Syria Dropped ‘Barrel Bombs’ Despite Ban, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Syria: Rights Group Reports on Use of ‘Barrel Bombs’ by Assad Forces

snippet: Human Rights Watch said Tuesday that the Syrian government had dropped so-called barrel bombs on hundreds of heavily populated rebel-held areas in the past year, flouting a United Nations Security Council measure.
